poem:
"Morning News, Cup in Hand"

Under the heavy banner of war,
New actors emerge on the stage,
Private armies, bards of bore,
In Putin's menacing palisade.

Aid wrapped in bundle of billions,
A lifeline to brave Ukraine,
Leaders gather, and human millions,
Hold their breath against the strain.

In the lines of text I trace,
The world unwinds in a steady race.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war live: former Wagner units join Russian national guard known as Putin’s ‘private army’ – as it happened 11.44am GMT Closing summary Thank you for following the Guardian’s Russia-Ukraine war live blog. It will be closed shortly but you can follow updates from the Brussels EU leaders summit, where a deal was reached on Thursday for a €50bn aid package for Ukraine, via this blog. You can also find the latest news on Russia". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Russia-Ukraine war live: former Wagner units join Russian national guard known as Putin’s ‘private army’ – as it happened 11.44am GMT Closing summary Thank you for following the Guardian’s Russia-Ukraine war live blog. It will be closed shortly but you can follow updates from the Brussels EU leaders summit, where a deal was reached on Thursday for a €50bn aid package for Ukraine, via this blog. You can also find the latest news on Russia
